message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
for(Iterator<String> it = strings.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
    sb.append(it.next());
    if(it.hasNext()){
        sb.append(",");
    }
}
String result = sb.toString();
<<<explanation>>>: You're using an Iterator to traverse through the Iterable. For each element, you append it to the StringBuilder. If there is another element after the current one, you append a comma. This way, you won't have a trailing comma at the end of your string.
